newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-MILAN'S BLOMQVIST HAS BAN REDUCED.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-MILAN'S BLOMQVIST HAS BAN REDUCED.

text.p: AC Milan's Swedish midfielder Jesper Blomqvist had a three-match ban for violent play reduced to two matches on Friday after his club appealed.
Italy's league disciplinary commission said it had cut the ban, imposed by a sporting judge after Blomqvist was sent off against Bologna on February 16.

During that match Blomqvist scored in the 84th minute of the serie A match, his first goal since arriving in Italy in December, and was then sent off four minutes later for a heavy tackle on Russian Igor Shalimov.
Milan had argued for a one-match ban.
